name: Indygo (itch) (Pigmentum Game Studio)
description:
Indygo is a narrative game with point ‘n’ click elements set in one room only – a painting workshop. It tells the story of a painter who locked himself out of the world.

The main topic of the game is depression and isolation. Indygo attempts to illustrate what people affected by mood disorders may experience.

Features:

  • Deep, melancholy atmosphere thanks to high quality handmade art and originally composed soundtrack.
  • Intriguing story evolving at every subtle, seemingly trivial decision.
  • Engaging narrative with multiple endings depending on the decisions made by the player.
  • Unique, ever-changing room which reacts to the mental state of the main character.
